comment: Took this class as an online summer course and she is very aware of how rushed it is. work level seems heavy, its a summer class so, expected. accepting of late work as long as you email, gives lots of extra credit, and is responsive with every homework. If you don't get an 100 on one of the assignments, she will absolutely tell you why.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Take this class for your Spanish credit. Prof Bernardy seems really nice and the class is not that difficult. All the assignment are done on Mcgraw Hill but they do not take that long to complete. 100% would recommend.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Online Savvy

comment: Omg, the entire course is just McGraw. I speak Spanish and I literally can't stand it. I wish there was variety. The work takes HOURS to complete. I almost pulled my hair out once. It might not be fully her fault tho... I've taken other Spanish courses online and it was similar. But at least it had variety.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: DON'T TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! This class didn't have a book or any helpful lectures. She is not helpful at all. Worst class ever!

Took SPAN3303 online with this prof. Class wasn't awful, just that it was allllll reading and not a single video lecture/auditory resource besides songs and documentaries she'd use as examples. She's pretty nice and often will give opportunity to fix mistakes on assignments. Just wish that she had some auditory explanations/video lectures
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Worst Professor ever. I am a senior and I hated her class so much. I never complain about professors ever. But her modules were confusing. She does not post anything through d2l but Word documents for you to submit back. He exams and quizzes confusing. Horrible! She is super sarcastic too.

Professor Bernardy is a wonderful example of a professor who cares about us learning a new language properly. As a native speaker of Spanish, I was able to finally relearn certain aspects of the language to fully understand it. Her class also uses some modern Spanish songs so we understand the culture better. She's very nice & a great professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Online Savvy

comment: If you're looking to verbally practice your Spanish, this is not the right class. You listen to many songs and read several articles/news headlines in class. She assigns hw after every class and only has 3-4 major assignments, so stay focused! She's no-nonsense, but communicate with her and she'll give you grace!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Bernardy was a really tough grader and gives LOTS of homework. I took her summer class and it was definitely a more challenging course for the summer so beware of that. She isn't afraid to dock major points for minor mistakes (like forgetting an accent mark). Proofread 10000 times before submitting anything to her. Hardest A I ever earned.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--EXTRA CREDIT--Tough grader

comment: I am a native speaker with no grammar practice or knowledge in spanish, so it was challenging. The teacher had all of the assignments and lessons clearly explained and layed out, very organized. I took this in the summer so it was fast paced, but manageable. Overall I enjoyed this class and the professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: I am one who has truly struggled comprehending Spanish in other classes. I took this as an online class, and the homework she gives can be tedious, but it definitely helps. The final was a conversation with her plus a written final. She was definitely generous in how she graded the conversation. Just study and you will be okay.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Caring

comment: No matter how hard you work in this class, you're probably not going to get an A. She is very condescending towards non-native speakers, there is no actual teaching--just old music videos and terrible poems. It's all busy work and you will not learn anything. If you ask for help--she tells you to read again. Don't take her if you can avoid it
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Tough grader

comment: i had her online span 3303 and the course was VERY well put together and the info was easy to learn. she responded to my emails within the day, and lost times within an hour or two. Dont hesitate to communicate with her, shes super sweet and humorous. phenomenal feedback,, so that you understand your mistakes. great teacher.

comment: Heavily favors native speakers, ridiculous in-class participation rubric. Difficult without learning a lot. Busy work lots of homework.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Literally the worst professor!!!!!!!! Worked hard all summer, went in the final with an A and came out with a B. She does not teach or post videos or maybe because it was an online class. Learned nothing.
If you are serious about learning Spanish, she is a great professor. If you are taking the class to check the box, so to speak, you will be challenged.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Inspirational

comment: Expect homework due every class. Attendance is mandatory and by mandatory I mean you cant skip even one class without losing points because she does participation points each day, hw is turned in in class and quizzes are the beginning of class once a week. Homework is unclear more times than not. Overall very heavy coursework.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Attendance is mandatory, and in every class you do activities on/ discuss the homework for the entire class. The assignments aren't too hard, they're more just time-consuming. She's a nice person who wants you to succeed, even if it means having to put in a bit more work. Grades homework liberally but essays/presentations are graded more harshly.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: Online class was SUPER WORK LOAD HEAVY. BE PREPARED FOR A TON OF BUSY WORK. Super tough grader too.. The amount of assignments I received 0-25% on was INCREDIBLY disheartening. The instructions were not always clear and I had several emails never responded to.. VERY frustrating class... Made me lose a lot of interest in learning Spanish.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: She is very nice but there's A LOT of homework! There are assignments due each class and on Sunday nights online. However, once or twice when I was unable to submit an online assignment on time, I printed it out and brought it to class and she accepted it. She helped me better understand grammar and I'm much more confident in my Spanish.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: While her grading is strict, she is more than happy to go over work and answer clarifying questions. Just be sure to ask them! Participate, do the homework, and come to class and you should be fine. There are quizzes, but if you take good notes, you should get a good grade. No final exam but a final presentation and paper. She is funny and nice!!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She gives very unclear instructions and has homework due every single class. She has pop quizzes once a week usually. She grades harsh usually but is sometimes nice. All the class is is group work she doesnt teach anything. However participation really matters and if you dont go to class you get a 0 for the day.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Bernardy is an okay professor. She is rude and will make you feel inferior. Her directions are not very clear and there is homework due twice a week. Normally, there are quizzes once a week and participation matters. Do not be late to class. She is tough grader, always give more information than she is asking for. I will not take her again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Shes awful. You have to do ridiculous amounts of homework twice a week (due every class, printed out and submitted online BOTH or it doesnt count) and it counts for 40% of the class grade. I got A's on most major assignments but didnt do the homework a few times and got a D. She doesnt seem to give a single crap about her students. DO NOT TAKE HER.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Taking this class was the worst decision ever. It felt like a constant cycle of do homework, talk about homework, group discussion about homework, do the same home work again. It was absolutely horrible. At least 3 different assignments a week and horribly infantile literature. DO NOT TAKE THIS TEACHER!!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Group work every class. You do the homework then talk about it in class. That's it. Doesn't answer her emails. She's a kind lady, but not as a professor. Grading is strict. She docked my presentation for things that weren't on the rubric. Overall her teaching is a solid 2/10 in terms of understanding and learning. Also, instructions are unclear.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is amazing. I learned a lot from her. She is strict but if you're a good student you'll be just fine. Go to her office hours. She's great one-on-one. I wish i could take her again for another Spanish course. There will be a lot of reading and writing! and brush up on conversation skills. Also she's great to talk to in Spanish for practice!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Bernardy is more of a professional professor rather than down to earth person. It makes her more distant. She gives a lot of homework (assignments due every Tues. and Thurs.) and a quiz every week. The only test I remember taking is the final. The grade easily averages out to an A or B if you put in the work.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Dr. Bernardy is an extremely tough professor, she won't give you any oppurtunity to redo any assignements, and if you are a native she expects a lot from you and the grammatical side will be harder for native speakers. not your average spanish class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I have a very mixed opinion towards her. Homework assignments nor quizzes aren't hard. Her attitude can really rub you the wrong way though. she'll pick on you constantly if you're even a few minutes late. You lose credit if you don't print your homework.  If she feels like you're not paying attention she'll get on you. Can be chill but very moody

Don't expect to be given actual lessons. She provides assignments, and the occasional unclear example. Her assignment instructions are very confusing/indirect, and she will simply refuse to grade your assignments over formatting differences rather than look to see if the student understands the concept.

She just gives a lot of nonsensical work. She says it's not busy work, but that's exactly what it is. I didn't learn much from what I previously knew. Her instructions aren't clear and she's all over the place with them . She stuffs way too much material into a short span of time . She could of been more tactful about her set up. Don't take her.

Dra. Bernardy gives lots of homework and quizzes. Sometimes, directions are not that clear. Attendance is mandatory and will influence your grade. She takes it before every class. The silver lining: if you work hard, do all the assignments to the best of your ability, and show up for class, the class will be an easy A or B. Don't take this online.

The class was online and it was not that easy. She is just not a thorough person. She doesn't really describe what to do on an assignment very well. There are a lot of assignments. You have something due tuesday, thursday, and a quiz on it sunday. Final is not online, it is taken at one of the testing centers.

One of the best classes I have ever taken.  I learned so much from Dr.  B.  You must work to get the full benefit.  The activities are excellent and invaluable.  Work hard and you will be glad you did. This course and professor helped me to read, hear, and speak better.    A wonderful course and responsive professor. Take this course.  It is great!

3 assignments due every Tuesday, 2 assignments due every Thursday, and a quiz that is only available from Friday-Sunday. I personally do not like the set-up of the class, but she does respond to emails quickly. Be prepared to spend a lot of time on this class. I do not like how there is so much due each week, but it does help buffer your grade.
She is willing to go over the top to help all students.  Extremelly smart and dinamic.
Very good and helpful Professor. She is willing to go over the top to help all students.  Extremelly smart and dinamic.
Quite possibly the worst professor I have ever had. Rather upsetting considering that she is supposed to be teaching us as future teachers ourselves!?

Horrible. Plays favorites. i did all of my homework assignments and never missed class. She gave my classmate a C and she stopped coming to class the last 2 or 3 weeks and did not even take the final. I did and received a D. She is distant and uptight. I am an A student so this course ruined my GPA.

Weather  you are a native speaker or not homework assigments are very important to make a good grade.  The whole class is in spanish,  She is very respectful, cares if you go to class everytime. and helps  you if you go to her office with questions.  Good class overall.

Really good teacher...and friend. if you want to do well in Spanish....if you are a good student overall and hard working student to do homework on time then you will do very well in her class....one she does not favor anyone...but only the ones that wants to do well and shows that they work hard and participate and does not miss classes...good

She showed favortisim to the native speakers. She failed to properly record my H.W assignments. I know this cuz The ones that i emailed and received a grade for, i had to forward them all to her.  I don't reccomend her. I tried to skype her for help that she said she would give and i got no Response. Gracias a ella, sin graduacion para mi!
Go to class and do your assignements. She is very helpful and you will learn a lot. If you are a very dedicated student you will do very well in this class. I recomend her anytime.

Dr. Bernardy is an excellent teacher! as a teacher candidate she is expecting lot from you, but if you are smart and do your homework(lots) participate in class, she will help you, of course you have to let her know that you need help...for those who wrote previous comments..this is COLLEGE not high school it suppose to be hard!
Organized class.  Attend and do assignments and it is pretty easy. But if you struggle with something don't expect help.  Teacher does not care!

She is VERY HELPFUL, and EXTREMELY APROACHABLE! she has helped me LOTS with her class and other classes within the department! whoever says they didnt do good in her class and that shes not a good teacher, are probably slakers! If you do your work and come to class and participate you will get a good grade! and if you need help she will help you!

Dr. Bernardy is not a very good teacher at all. She has to much power in the Education Department at KSU. I love the school and like all the teachers. Dr. Bernardy just gives the impression that she does not want to be approached by any student. Should personality count when one teaches at a University?  What about compassion?  She's horrible!

Dr. Bernardy is one of the most helpful teachers out there. Her class is very hard, but if you show the effort and go to her office to discuss your difficulties, she's very understanding! You must work hard to get an A! She is expects a lot, but is very fair. If you take it easy, you will not make a good grade! I learned a lot and from her class!!!
Dr. Bernardy's first review here is obviously written by her as propaganda. She is rude, unhelpful an BORING. She is also a liar and ruins people's careers.
POP QUIZZES, HER CLASS CAN BE CONFUSING AND TEST ARE UNCLEAR. SHE IS VERY BORING. DONT TAKE HER IF YOU CAN>

She is the Drector of the Foreign Language Education Department.  When I had a severe problem with my evaluator, she refused to let me change evaluators. I had no choice but to drop the course. She told me that since I dropped the course, I was out of the program for good. I had a 4.0 at KSU and that was the only class left for me to be certified.
Very easy class and boring teacher.

She's a nice person, but she's a little hard to take as a teacher. The class is very participation-based, with attendance a must! There's an assignment almost every night, but it's hard to tell which ones are graded. The coursework is kinda confusing, so make sure you follow along and don't get too far behind.
She's sweet, but she's boring. And theres a lot of work.
Tough class, tough teacher!
Lots of group activities that sometimes feel useless and not appropiate for the class. Attendance is a big thing and be prepared to participate alot in class.

Advanced Grammar and Linguistics: This class should of been alot easire than what it turned out to be.  Her pop quizzes are not clear and they are very frustrating. Tests: same thing about the pop quizzes.
Demanding, but fair.
Great teacher. Very passionate about subject matter. Clear expectations on midterm and final. Lot of class involvement (group activities, presentations, etc.)
